qas.question: According to most linguistics, who speaks a dialect?
What do only a few linguists believe people speak?
According to the least used definition, what does everyone speak?
What are used to distinguish between two varieties of different languages only?
What does the criteria believe everybody speaks?

context: By the definition most commonly used by linguists, any linguistic variety can be considered a "dialect" of some language—"<a0_0>everybody<a0_0/> speaks <b2_0><b4_0>a <b1_0>dialect<b4_0/><b2_0/><b1_0/>". According to that interpretation, <b3_0>the criteria<b3_0/> above merely serve to distinguish whether two varieties are dialects of the same language or dialects of different languages.
